\def\myCount#1{(#1)}

\newcommand{\decisionTree}{
\begin{tikzpicture}[scale=1.3]
\tikzstyle{every node}=[font=\small]
%nodes
\draw (5, 22.75) rectangle node {\myCount{1} need a new car} (7.75, 21.5);
\draw (4.75, 20.5) rectangle node {\myCount{2} check the annual cost} (8.25, 19);
\draw (6, 18.25) rectangle node {\myCount{3} public charging station nearby} (11, 17.25);
\draw (7, 16.25) rectangle node {\myCount{4} other reasons} (9.75, 15);
\draw (9.25, 14.25) rectangle node {\myCount{5} check the profile} (12, 13);
\draw (12.5, 11.75) ellipse (1.75cm and 0.5cm) node {buy \CV};
\draw (7.75, 11.75) ellipse (1.75cm and 0.5cm) node {buy \PHEV};
\draw (3, 11.75) ellipse (1.75cm and 0.5cm) node {buy \EV};
\draw (10.5, 22.25) ellipse (1.5cm and 0.5cm) node {don't buy};

\draw[-latex] (7.75, 22.25) to (9, 22.25);
\node at (8.25, 22.5) {N};
\draw[-latex] (6.25, 21.5) to (6.25, 20.5);
\node at (6.5, 21) {Y};
%EV
\draw (4.75, 20) to (3, 20);
\node at (4, 20.25) {\EV};
\draw[-latex] (3, 20) to (3, 12.25);
%PHEV
\draw (5.5, 19) to (5.5, 13);
\node at (4.9, 18.25) {\PHEV};
\draw (5.5, 13) to (7.75, 13);
\draw[-latex] (7.75, 13) to (7.75, 12.25);
\node at (9.1, 12.75) {\PHEV};
\draw (9.75, 13) to (9.75, 12.5);
\draw (9.75, 12.5) to (7.75, 12.5);
%CV
\draw (11, 17.75) to (12.5, 17.75);

\draw (11.25, 13) to (11.25, 12.5);
\draw (11.25, 12.5) to (12.5, 12.5);

\draw (8.25, 19.75) to (8.5, 19.75);

\end{tikzpicture}
}%
